p: When Ren et al. studied the protective mechanism of 6-gingerol on cardiomyocytes H9c2 cells, they found that 6-gingerol had cytoprotective effect on hypoxia-induced injury in a concentration-dependent manner at a lower concentration (5–50 μm). Their experimental results showed that 6-gingerol inhibited the expression of BNIP3 and activated the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway, which resulted in the inhibition of apoptosis and autophagy [ 44]. Whether there are other mechanisms of cardioprotective activity of ZRR requires further study.
